markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fortress Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=21)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bulwark" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=202" />
<trait label="Entrench Ranged" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=474" />
<trait label="Ponderous" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=486" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 10 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 32 gp

**AC Bonus** +6

**Dex Cap** +0

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 18

**Bulk** 5

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

[Dwarves](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1) of Dongun Hold developed fortress plate, which is still popular in Alkenstar and Dongun Hold. A trained wearer can adjust the articulated armor's overlapping layers of plates and panels to provide protection from missiles.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Black Hole Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1842)
name: Fortress Plate
